trans-unit.source: Represents a hidden field used to store a non-displayed value.

In this topic: - [Introduction](#introduction) - [Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax) ## Introduction The HiddenField control is used to store a value that needs to be persisted across posts to the server.
It is rendered as an `<input type= "hidden"/>` element.
Normally view state, session state, and cookies are used to maintain the state of a Web Forms page.
However, if these methods are disabled or are not available, you can use the HiddenField control to store state values.
To specify the value for a HiddenField control, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField.Value%2A> property.

You can provide a routine that gets called every time the value of the HiddenField control changes between posts to the server by creating an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField.ValueChanged> event.
## Declarative Syntax ``` ```
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create a new instance of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> class.
Creates an <xref href="System.Web.UI.EmptyControlCollection"></xref> object used to indicate that child controls are not allowed.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.CreateControlCollection%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method is normally used to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection?displayProperty=fullName> object for storing the child controls of a Web Server control.
In this implementation of the method, an <xref:System.Web.UI.EmptyControlCollection?displayProperty=fullName> collection is always returned to indicate that child controls are not allowed.
Always returns an <xref href="System.Web.UI.EmptyControlCollection"></xref> object.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether themes apply to this control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> control does not support themes.
This property has been overridden to always return `false`.
If you attempt to set this property, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> exception is thrown.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to indicate that this control does not support themes.
An attempt is made to set this property.
Sets input focus to this control.
Setting focus to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> control is not supported.
A <xref:System.NotSupportedException> is thrown if you attempt to call this method.
An attempt is made to call this method.
Processes postback data for a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField"></xref> control.

The Web Forms page framework tracks all the server controls that return `true` to this method call, then invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> on those controls.
The key identifier for the control.
The collection of all incoming name values.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField"></xref> control's state changes as a result of the postback; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.PreRender"></xref> event.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> object that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField.ValueChanged"></xref> event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField.ValueChanged> event is raised when the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> control changes between posts to the server.
This allows you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine whenever this event occurs.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The OnValueChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> object that contains the event data.
Notifies the ASP.NET application that the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField"></xref> control has changed.

The RaisePostDataChangedEvent method is a helper method used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> class to notify the ASP.NET application that the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> control has changed.
Renders the Web server control content to the client's browser using the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.
The Render method is used to render the server control content to the client's browser using the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter?displayProperty=fullName> object.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object used to render the server control content on the client's browser.
Gets or sets the skin to apply to the control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> control does not support themes.
This property has been overridden to always return an empty string.
If you attempt to set this property, a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> is thrown.
Always returns an empty string ("") to indicate that themes are not supported.
An attempt is made to set this property.
For a description of this member, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.LoadPostData%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
The key identifier for the control.
The collection of all incoming name values.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the server control's state changes as a result of the postback; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
Gets or sets the value of the hidden field.
Use the Value property to specify or determine the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> control.
The value of the hidden field.
The default is an empty string ("").
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField"></xref> control changes between posts to the server.
The ValueChanged event is raised when the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HiddenField> control changes between posts to the server.
This allows you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine whenever this event occurs.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
To be added.
